article.headline: Central Arkansas 70 Nicholls 66
article.story: THIBODAUX, La. (AP) -- Freshman Marcus Pillow had 17 points, all but two from 3-point goals, as Central Arkansas beat Nicholls State 70-66 on Saturday. The Bears (9-20, 3-12 Southland), one of the worst perimeter shooting teams in the conference, hit 11 3-pointers, including 5 of 10 from Pillow. Durrell Nevels finished with 18 points, Nate Bowie 14 and Frederick Campbell 10. The Colonels (7-21, 6-8), who had won four of their past five games, were only 8 of 32 (25 percent) from 3-point range after making a season-high 14 in their last game. Seven 3-pointers helped the Bears take a 38-30 halftime lead. Sophomore Ryan Bathie hit a 3-point shot for Nicholls with 1:12 left to bring the Colonels within three points. Pillow hit two free throws with 29 seconds left for a 68-63 lead, and Fred Campbell hit another pair. Justin Payne hit a 3-point shot for Nicholls for the final score. Adonis Gray led the Colonels with 19 points. Stefan Blaszczynski added 18 and Bathie 14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
